item.title: Chinese coast guard rams Philippine vessel near Thitu island
item.description: A Chinese coast guard ship fired a powerful water cannon and rammed a Philippine government vessel on Sunday near Thitu island in the disputed South China Sea, the Philippine coast guard reported. The BRP Datu Pagbuaya, part of the fisheries fleet supporting Filipino fishermen, sustained minor dama

item.title: Cameroon heads to the polls as the world's oldest president bids to extend his rule
item.description: Polls opened in Cameroon on Sunday in an election that could see Africa’s oldest leader extend his rule by another 7 years. Around 8 million voters, including over 34,000 overseas, are registered to participate at more than 31,000 polling stations in the Central African nation. Cameroon had

item.title: All suspects acquitted over murder of RU Chhatra League activist Faruk Hossain
item.description: A court has acquitted all suspects in the 2010 murder case of Rajshahi University (RU) Chhatra League activist Faruk Hossain. Rajshahi Metropolitan Sessions Judge Zulfikar Ullah delivered the verdict in the widely discussed case around 2:15 pm on Sunday. All 114 accused in the case were leaders a

item.title: Executive Machines launches iPhone 17 series and iPhone Air in Bangladesh with exclusive offers
item.description: Executive Machines Ltd., your Apple Authorized Reseller and Authorized Service Provider since 2008, now has the new iPhone models available. item.title: Emirates unveils US$ 8m facility upskill 25 thousand cabin crew
item.description: Emirates has opened a new world-class facility in Dubai, to provide a luxurious training experience to almost 25,000 cabin crew, focused on the art of hospitality excellence. The USD 8 million learning zone and programme features a sprawling restaurant and lounge for up to 170 guests, elegant pres

item.title: Scrapping Flag Vessel Act sought to boost ocean-going shipping industry
item.description: Industry leaders have called for the repeal of the Bangladesh Flag Vessel (Protection) Act 2019, terming it outdated and a major barrier to the growth of the country’s ocean-going shipping and shipbuilding industries. Speaking at a seminar titled Investment Potentials in the Ocean-Going Vess

item.title: Court cancels bail plea of Asaduzzaman Noor in graft case
item.description: A Dhaka court on Sunday cancelled a plea of former minister Asaduzzaman Noor in a case lodged by the Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) for amassing illegal wealth. Dhaka Metropolitan Senior Special Judge Sabbir Faiz passed the order as Noor’s counsel moved the plea before the court, reports B

item.title: Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning star of ‘Annie Hall’ and ‘The Godfather,’ dies at 79
item.description: Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning actress known for her roles in Annie Hall, The Godfather series, and Father of the Bride, has died at 79, People Magazine reported, citing a family spokesperson. She passed away in California surrounded by loved ones. Keaton's career spanned decades, marked by her q

item.title: Envoy Textiles hosts ADB delegation following approval of US$ 30m sustainability financing package
item.description: Envoy Textiles Limited on Sunday hosted a high-level courtesy meeting with a delegation from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) at its Corporate Office on Panthpath, Dhaka. The meeting was convened following the recent approval of a USD 30 million financing package from ADB to support the company&rs

item.title: Judges must also be held accountable: ICT
item.description: The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) has said that those who deliver verdicts must also be held accountable for their mistakes and shortcomings. Tribunal-1 Chairman Md Golam Mortuza Mozumder made the remarks on Sunday during the hearing of arguments in a case filed against former prime minister
